amendment.description: An amemdment, printed as amendment No. 58 in the Congressional Record of September 24, 1997 to to prohibit funds from being used to purchase or install live fingerprint scanners in INS field offices, as well as card scanners inINS service centers, unless the INS agrees to refund all fees it received from private businesses applying for designation as a certified Designated fingerprinting service.

action.text: By unanimous consent, the Kleczka amendment was withdrawn.
